view.caption: Validate Data Passed to Unmanaged Code
Send Logs to a Log Server
Separate Data from SQL Query Syntax
Store Uploaded Files Outside Web Root
Include Unique Tokens in Sensitive Requests
Assign a New Session ID on Reauthentication
Do Not Place Sensitive Data in Persistent Cookies
Do Not Place Sensitive Data in Exposed Parameters
Do Not Make Session Cookies Persistent
Do Not Make Security Decisions Based on Exposed Parameters
Calculate Destinations of Redirects Without User Input
Use Unique Tokens for Sensitive Requests to Prevent CSRF
Use Iterative Hashing to Protect Stored Passwords
Perform an Architecture and Design Review
Integrate Security Activities into the Development Lifecycle
Only Allow Trusted Hosts to Connect
Require Authentication for All Sensitive Operations
Verify User Identity before Sending Recovery Tokens
Send Password Reset Tokens over a Side Channel
Verify Application Authenticity to the User
Check Authorization for System Resource Access
Use Reference Maps for Object Access
Split the Application in Public and Private Areas
Get the Size of an Array Correctly
Free Dynamically Allocated Memory Only Once
Set Pointers to Null After Deallocation
Do Not Cache Results of Security Checks
